subject: Design
title: IKEA Effect: Flat-Pack Changes the World
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on IKEA Effect: Flat-Pack Changes the World.

hook.text: In 1956, an IKEA employee removed a table's legs to fit it in a car. The flat-pack revolution began.

buildup.text: Ingvar Kamprad's vision was simple: beautiful design that a student can afford and carry home.

discovery.text: Flat-packing cut shipping costs by 80%, making Scandinavian design accessible worldwide.

twist.text: IKEA now sells one Billy bookcase every 5 seconds. One design, billions of homes.

climax.text: IKEA proved that the biggest design revolution isn't a new style â€” it's a new price point.

punchline.text: Design for everyone meant designing the box first.

quiz.question: What was the key innovation behind IKEA's flat-pack concept?
options: Removing legs to reduce shipping costs by 80%
